main_text:
Contemporaries’ Accounts of Harriet Taylor Mill || A More Balanced Assessment
2.3 A More Balanced Assessment

There is obviously a vast middle territory between these extremes.
Taylor Mill was not often described in judicious or balanced terms.
Nevertheless, Mill’s brother George, who knew her reasonably
well, did relate to Bain that “Mrs. Taylor was a clever and
remarkable woman, but nothing like what John took her to be”
(Bain 1882, 166).
